Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • Enemy
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DumbTargetingEnemy, SmartTargetingEnemy, StraightLineEnemy, WallFollowingEnemy

    public abstract class Enemy
extends java.lang.Object
    The Enemy class is an abstract class of the enemies that will be used in levels
    Creation Date: 20/11/19.
    Last Modification Date: 30/11/19.
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Szymon Grzech (988065), Timothy Roger (977422)

      • xDirection

        protected int xDirection
        The x and the y directions that the enemy is moving in, the can be either 1, -1 or 0.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy(int[] coords)
        Constructs an enemy.
        Parameters:
        coords - its (x,y) coordinates on the map.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public abstract void move(Character ch,
                          Cell[][] map)
        This is a move method for the enemies which is responsible for the enemies moving around the map, each enemy will have a different set of movements.
        Parameters:
        ch - the Character, used to get the characters coordinates and is used to kill the character if they are on the same coordinates.
        map - a 2D array of Cells on which the enemies move around.

      • characterCheck

        public void characterCheck(Character ch)
        This method is used to kill the character if the enemy and the character are on the same spot.
        Parameters:
        ch - the Character.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.lang.String IMAGE_FOLDER,
                 javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                 int x,
                 int y)
        A method to get the enemy to draw itself.
        Parameters:
        IMAGE_FOLDER - String - the path to the correct image folder.
        gc - the GraphicsContext.
        x - its X coordinate.
        y - its Y coordinate.

      • image

        public abstract javafx.scene.image.Image image(java.lang.String IMAGE_FOLDER)
        Every child of the enemy should have its own image.
        Parameters:
        IMAGE_FOLDER - String - the path to the correct image folder.
        Returns:
        the image.

        public int[] getEnemyCoords()

        the enemy coordinates in (x,y) format.
